get.summary: Get your orders, results is paginated.

parameters.description: Access key.

parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.
parameters.name: market

parameters.description: Filter order by state, default to 'wait' (active orders).
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned orders, default to 100.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Specify the page of paginated results.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: If set, returned orders will be sorted in specific order, default to 'asc'.
parameters.name: order_by

parameters.description: Tonce is an integer represents the milliseconds elapsed since Unix epoch.

parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.
parameters.name: market

parameters.description: Either 'sell' or 'buy'.
parameters.name: side

parameters.description: The amount user want to sell/buy. An order could be partially executed, e.g. an order sell 5 btc can be matched with a buy 3 btc order, left 2 btc to be sold; in this case the order's volume would be '5.0', its remaining_volume would be '2.0', its executed volume is '3.0'.
parameters.name: volume

parameters.description: Price for each unit. e.g. If you want to sell/buy 1 btc at 3000 CNY, the price is '3000.0'
parameters.name: price

get.summary: Get the order book of specified market.

parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.
parameters.name: market

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned sell orders. Default to 20.
parameters.name: asks_limit

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned buy orders. Default to 20.
parameters.name: bids_limit

get.summary: Get depth or specified market. Both asks and bids are sorted from highest price to lowest.

parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.
parameters.name: market

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned price levels. Default to 300.
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: Get recent trades on market, each trade is included only once. Trades are sorted in reverse creation order.

parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.
parameters.name: market

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned trades. Default to 50.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only trades executed before the time will be returned.
parameters.name: timestamp

parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created after the trade will be returned.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created before the trade will be returned.
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: If set, returned trades will be sorted in specific order, default to 'desc'.
parameters.name: order_by

get.summary: Get server current time, in seconds since Unix epoch.
Get OHLC(k line) of specific market.

parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.
parameters.name: market

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned data points, default to 30.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Time period of K line, default to 1. You can choose between 1, 5, 15, 30, 60, 120, 240, 360, 720, 1440, 4320, 10080
parameters.name: period

parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only k-line data after that time will be returned.
parameters.name: timestamp

get.summary: Get K data with pending trades, which are the trades not included in K data yet, because there's delay between trade generated and processed by K data generator.

parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.
parameters.name: market

parameters.description: The trade id of the first trade you received.
parameters.name: trade_id

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned data points, default to 30.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Time period of K line, default to 1. You can choose between 1, 5, 15, 30, 60, 120, 240, 360, 720, 1440, 4320, 10080
parameters.name: period

parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only k-line data after that time will be returned.
parameters.name: timestamp
